Text:
All this to say one simple thing: thank you.

5/5
https://t.co/uAuAouEUI6

And in this past half year, I’ve been overwhelmed by the enthusiasm and kindness of the newsletter community, and also by the determination to create a better world, and the conviction that it's possible even when things look bleak.

4/5

I woke up the other morning and realized that I've been writing a newsletter almost every day for six months now.

I certainly didn't plan to write everyday, but with so much going on, I felt compelled to.

3/5

Getting the truth out and showing what’s really happening is a vital part of what I’m trying to do.

There is no simple solution, but community is part of the answer — finding people who believe in social justice, human rights, and democracy.

2/5

I’m getting to be an older man. I’ve served in several administrations, taught two generations, and encountered spin, lies, and outright propaganda.

But I’ve never before experienced such blatant attacks on the truth as we are now witnessing — both abroad and in the US.

1/5

They were all nominated by a Republican president who lost the popular vote in their first election.

Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, if confirmed, would become the first ever former public defender on the Supreme Court. It's past time.

Criminalizing gender-affirming care, banning books, outlawing abortions...

The GOP is not the party of limited government. It’s not the party of "freedom," either.

The GOP's discriminatory, invasive agenda is on full display. We need to continue getting loud about this.

Baristas at a Seattle Starbucks just *unanimously* voted to unionize. This vote holds particular significance as it took place in Starbucks’ hometown, and is the first store on the West Coast to unionize.

Congratulations to @SBWorkersUnited for continuing to make history.

The Child Tax Credit expansion lifted millions of kids out of poverty.

In the annals of American history we have never had a government program that so clearly and directly helped so many in such direct need.

Poverty is a policy choice. It’s not too late to renew the expansion.

Russia is the world’s second largest crude oil exporter and the primary source of global natural gas.

We need to transition to renewable energies if we have any hope of keeping the earth habitable, and freeing our economy from the influence of geopolitical foes.

A new abortion ban bill in Tennessee would allow rapists’ families and friends to sue if victims have an abortion.

The legislation would ban abortion entirely with no exception for rape or incest.

Bills like these aren’t “pro-life”. They’re inhumane.
We need a public defender on the Supreme Court. Confirm Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson.

Being forced to carry an unwanted pregnancy to term means:

Families are 4x more likely to live below the poverty line

Parents are 3x less likely to have full-time work

Parents are 6x more likely to receive public assistance

Abortion bans aren’t pro-life. They’re pro-poverty. https://t.co/yhXYxIRCr0

Republicans are criticizing Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson for her work representing the poor and marginalized as a public defender.

That experience is precisely why she’s perfect for the job.

Six months ago, when I began my newsletter, I wanted to grow a community where readers could both get the truth and share their lived experiences. Since then, I’ve been overwhelmed by the response — and determination to create a better world. Thank you. https://t.co/uAuAounjQy

Chevron posted $15.6 billion in profits last year — yet claims that workers' pay demands “exceeded what the company believes to be reasonable.” Please.

The workers are asking for a $3 raise.

A version of it has also taken over a major political parties in the U.S. — and just as we defend democracies across the globe, we must come together to defend democracy at home.

We must stop corporate profiteering.

"They had begun to consider the government of the United States as a mere appendage to their own affairs. We know now that government by organized money is just as dangerous as government by organized mob." 
-- Franklin D. Roosevelt
"We had to struggle with the old enemies of peace -- business and financial monopoly, speculation, reckless banking, class antagonism, sectionalism, war profiteering." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt
So let me get this straight: The same Republicans who complain about cancel culture were on a debate stage about to brawl because someone said something they didn't like?

Putin's authoritarian playbook: 

1) Spin lies to justify military action. 
2) Break int'l law, target civilians.
3) Threaten nuclear war. 
4) Call for a purge of "traitors."
5) Hold mass rallies to build support.
6) Repeat. 

It's a dangerous descent into madness.

Since 2020, Georgia’s GOP legislators have passed 8 bills reorganizing county election boards that oversee election offices. The newly installed Republicans are reducing poll locations & canceling Sunday voting.

Pay attention. This sort of sabotage is underway all across the US.

Big Oil companies could absolutely absorb the higher costs of crude oil.

But they’re so big they simply don’t have to. They’re not worried about losing market share to competitors.

So, instead, they pass on costs to us in the form of higher prices — and pocket record profits.

Last year Big Oil spent $38,000,000,000 on stock buybacks.

This year, thanks in part to Putin, the oil giants are planning to buy back at least $22,000,000,000 *more*.

We pay through the nose at the gas pump — while Big Oil's pockets get even fatter.

Windfall profits tax. Now.
